envelope.title: Integrate SCE Engine into ISA-GCS Governance Pipeline
envelope.author: Louis Pearson

proposal.summary: This proposal integrates the SCE (Semantic Compute Engine) into the ISA-GCS governance pipeline as a first-class execution and evaluation component, enabling calibrated, metric-constitutional evaluation of governance envelopes and proposals.
proposal.motivation: To align execution behavior with Genesis Governance v4.0, ensure calibration non-regression, and enable envelope-level evaluation using ψ₅/SE and lattice-based benchmarking within the live governance engine.

actions.description: Wire SCE evaluation outputs into the ISA-GCS governance evaluation stage as a required precondition for proposal classification and scoring.
Bind SCE calibration non-regression guard to Genesis Governance Article V.4 and enforce auto-fail on calibration regression events.
Enable ψ₅/SE and envelope delta telemetry export from SCE into the governance benchmarking and reporting layers.

dependencies: SCE core engine available and compiled

sectionsImpacted: Article IV — Emergency Eligibility and Rollback
constitutional.notes: SCE integration must remain subordinate to Article 0 and Article 0.1, and must not introduce new sources of execution authority beyond ψ₅ and SE.
